turtle

Class Playground

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • turtle.GameGrid
              • turtle.Playground
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class Playground
extends GameGrid
    Class that represents a grapics window where the turtles live. The coordintate system is centered in the middle of the window and the range is -200..200 in both direction (x coordinate to the right, y coordinate to the top). The class is derived from GameGrid, but most of the GameGrid methods are made protected, so they are only exposed indirectly to the user and not seen in the JavaDoc.

    When the playground appears, a green colored turtle, called the global turtle is created too. It is invisible until showTurtle() or st() is called. but it may draw traces right from the start. The global turtle is affected by Turtle methods reproduced in the Playground class. If the turtle was never shown, its speed is MAXSPEED; when it is shown the first time, its speed is 5.

    All playground touch events run in distinct separate threads to allow multi-turtle movements.

    If an application class constructor is used, it must be declared public..

    • Constructor Detail

      • Playground

        public Playground(java.lang.String turtleImage)
        Same as Playground(), but the turtle seed image is loaded from the sdcard. The given filename is a relative path starting from the root "/mnt/sdcard/". The sprite image size should be chosen optimal compared to the virtual -200..200 playground size. (The image is automatically zoomed at runtime accordingly to the current current screen resolution.) The sprite image should be oriented to the east and use a transparent background. white pixels (0xFFFFFF, any alpha) take the current turtle color. Other pixel colors will display unchanged.

        The turtle image cannot be selected individually for each turtle. Use JDroidLib if you want to create animated actor games.

        If the image cannot be loaded, the app is terminated with an error message.
        Parameters:
        turtleImage - the relative path to the image file (best is png format) e.g "sprites/car.png"

        If an application class constructor is used, it must be declared public..

      • Playground

        public Playground()
        Creates a square sized playground that fits the device screen. It's orientation depends on the device orientation when the application starts, but it remains fixed, when the device is rotated. The background color is dark blue (Color.rgb(0, 0, 128)) and the border color white. The turtle coordinate system is a independent of the pixel resolution with double coordinates x = -200..200 from left to right and y = -200..200 from bottom to top (center in the middle of the playground).

        If an application class constructor is used, it must be declared public..

      • getTurtlesNear

        public java.util.ArrayList<Turtle> getTurtlesNear(double xCenter,
                                         double yCenter,
                                         double radius)
        Returns the list of turtles that intersect with the given circle (in paint order: subsequent turtle in the list are painted on top of preceding actors. Hidden turtles are considered to be present). The global turtle is not considered.
        Parameters:
        xCenter - the x coordinate of the center (turtle coordinate system)
        yCenter - the y coordinate of the center (turtle coordinate system)
        radius - the radius of the circle (turtle coordinates)
        Returns:
        a list of all turtles (except the global turtle) whose surrounding circle intersects with the given circle; empty list, if no turtle intersects

      • getTopTurtleNear

        public Turtle getTopTurtleNear(double xCenter,
                      double yCenter,
                      double radius)
        Returns the topmost turtle reference that intersect with the given circle. Hidden turtles are considered to be present. The global turtle is not considered.
        Parameters:
        xCenter - the x coordinate of the center (turtle coordinate system)
        yCenter - the y coordinate of the center (turtle coordinate system)
        radius - the radius of the circle (turtle coordinates)
        Returns:
        a reference of the topmost turtle whose surrounding circle intersects with the given circle; null, if no turtle intersects.

      • setSpeed

        public Turtle setSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the global turtle's speed.
        0: stopped 1..10: speed values for the moving animation MAXSPEED (= -1) : no animation, maximal speed
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed of the turtle (0..10, MAXSPEED)

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Returns the current speed (0..10, -1 for MAXSPEED) of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        the current speed

      • forward

        public Turtle forward(double s)
        Moves the global turtle forward. s in turtle coordinates (coordinate system x = -200..200 to right, y = -200..200 upward).
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move forward, if s < 0 moves back
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fd

        public Turtle fd(double s)
        Short for forward().

      • back

        public Turtle back(double s)
        Moves the global turtle back. s in turtle coordinates (coordinate system x = -200..200 to right, y = -200..200 upward).
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move back, if s < 0 moves forward
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • bk

        public Turtle bk(double s)
        Short for back().

        Returns:

        public Turtle rt(double angle)
        Short for right().

      • left

        public Turtle left(double angle)
        Turns global the turtle to the left (counter clockwise).
        Parameters:
        angle - the turning angle (in degrees), if angle < 0 turns right
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • lt

        public Turtle lt(double angle)
        Short for left().

      • beep

        public static void beep()
        Emits a beep (1000 Hz sine wave of 100 ms duration). (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clean

        public static void clean()
        Erases the playground by filling it with the current playground color. The turtles remain visible at their current position. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clean

        public static void clean(int color)
        Erases the playground by filling it with the given color. The turtles remain visible at their current position. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clears the playground by filling it with the current playground color. All turtle images and traces are erased, but the turtles remain (hidden) at their current positions. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clear

        public static void clear(int color)
        Clears the playground by filling it with the given color. All turtle images and traces are erased, but the turtles remain (hidden) at their current positions. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • hideTurtle

        public Turtle hideTurtle()
        Hides the global turtle. The traces are still drawn, if pen is down. If there is only one turte, the speed is set to -1, so the turtle animation is disabled. Hiding the turtle speeds up the graphics enormously.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • ht

        public Turtle ht()
        Short for hideTurtle().

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        Reports the current visibility of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle is currently hidden; otherwise false

      • showTurtle

        public Turtle showTurtle()
        Shows the global turtle if it was hidden before. The turtle is put on top of all other turtles. If the turtle was never shown, the current speed is set to 5, otherwise it is not modified.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • st

        public Turtle st()
        Short for showTurtle().

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the current global turtle color.
        Returns:
        the turtle color

      • setColor

        public Turtle setColor(int color)
        Sets the current global turtle color.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • setSize

        public Turtle setSize(int size)
        Sets the current turtle size. Big turtles use a lot of memory space and may cause a memory overflow on certain systems.
        Parameters:
        size - one of the constants Playground.SMALLSIZE, Playground.MEDIUMSIZE, Playground.BIGSIZE
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • getHeading

        public double getHeading()
        Returns the current heading (moving direction) of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        the heading in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise

      • setHeading

        public Turtle setHeading(double heading)
        Sets the current heading (moving direction) of the gloabal turtle. If speed is not MAXSPEED, the turtle rotation is animated, it turns to left or right for the smaller angle.
        Parameters:
        heading - in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • towards

        public double towards(double x,
             double y)
        Returns the direction (heading) of the global turtle from the current position to the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the target position
        y - the y coordinate of the target position
        Returns:
        the heading in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise

      • home

        public Turtle home()
        Puts the global turtle at home (center of playground, coordinates (0, 0). The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • isPenDown

        public boolean isPenDown()
        Reports the current pen state of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        true, if the pen is down, so traces are drawn; otherwise no traces are drawn

      • penDown

        public Turtle penDown()
        Lowers the global turtle's pen, so it draws traces when it moves.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • pd

        public Turtle pd()
        Short for penDown().

      • penUp

        public Turtle penUp()
        Lifts the global turtle's pen, so is does not draw traces when it moves.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • pu

        public Turtle pu()
        Short for penUp().

      • getPenWidth

        public int getPenWidth()
        Returns the current pen width of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        the pen width in pixels (not adjusted to current screen resolution)

      • setPenWidth

        public Turtle setPenWidth(int width)
        Sets the current pen width.
        Parameters:
        width - the pen width in pixels (independent of current screen resolution)
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • getPenColor

        public int getPenColor()
        Returns the current pen color of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        the pen color

      • setPenColor

        public Turtle setPenColor(int color)
        Sets the current pen color of the global turtle.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the pen
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • label

        public Turtle label(java.lang.String text)
        Same as label(text, textColor, textSize) with textColor = Color.WHITE and textSize = 15.

      • label

        public Turtle label(java.lang.String text,
           int textColor,
           int textSize)
        Paints the given text with given text color and given text height at the current global turtle position
        Parameters:
        text - the text to show
        textColor - the text color
        textSize - the text size in turtle coordinates
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • distance

        public double distance(double x,
              double y)
        Returns the distance from the current position of the global turtle to the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the target position
        y - the y coordinate of the target position
        Returns:
        the distance in turtle coordinates

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the current x coordinate of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        the turtle's x coordinate

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the current y coordinate of the global turtle.
        Returns:
        the turtle's y coordinate

      • setPos

        public Turtle setPos(double x,
            double y)
        Puts the global turtle to the given position. The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - the new turtle's x coordinate
        y - the new turtle's y coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • moveTo

        public Turtle moveTo(double x,
            double y)
        Puts the global turtle to the given position. The movement is not animated, but of pen is down a trace from the old to the new position is drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - the new turtle's x coordinate
        y - the new turtle's y coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • setX

        public Turtle setX(double x)
        Puts the global turtle to the given x coordinate. The y coordinate is maintained. The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - the new turtle's x coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • setY

        public Turtle setY(double y)
        Puts the global turtle to the given y coordinate. The x coordinate is maintained. The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Parameters:
        y - the new turtle's y coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(int time)
        Delays the execution for the given time. If you want to stop the current turtle's movements, set its speed to 0. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)
        Parameters:
        time - the time to wait (in ms)

      • fill

        public Turtle fill(double x,
          double y)
        Fills a bounded region of the playground with the current pen color (flood fill). It is assumed that the region is colored with the current playground color. The position of the turtle is not changed.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of a point inside the region
        y - the y coordinate of a point inside the region
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fill

        public Turtle fill()
        Same as fill(x, y), but using the current turtle position. If the turtle is sitting on its trace, a neighbor pixel with the playground color is searched.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • dot

        public Turtle dot()
        Draws a single point (dot) at the current turtle position using the current pen color.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • isOnBorder

        public boolean isOnBorder()
        Returns true, if the global turtle is on any of the 4 border lines.
        Returns:
        true, if one of the border lines intersects any of the non-transparent pixels of the turtle image

      • isOnBoarder

        public boolean isOnBoarder(int borderId)
        Returns true, if the turtle is on the selected border line.
        Parameters:
        borderId - 0: top border, 1: right border, 2: bottom border, 3: left border
        Returns:
        true, if the border line intersects any of the non-transparent pixels of the turtle image

      • isForwardValid

        public boolean isForwardValid(double s)
        Checks if the forward movement using the given step moves the turtle to a position outside the visible playground. The turtle's position remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move forward, if s < 0 moves back
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle remains inside the playground; otherwise false

      • isBackValid

        public boolean isBackValid(double s)
        Checks if the backward movement using the given step moves the turtle to a position outside the visible playground. The turtle's position remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move back, if s < 0 moves forward
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle remains inside the playground; otherwise false

      • fillToPoint

        public Turtle fillToPoint(double x,
                 double y)
        Attachs a imaginary rubber band between the global turtle and the given anchor point. When the turtle now moves, the area covered by the rubber band is filled with the current pen color. Filling is on until fillOff() is called.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the anchor point
        y - the y coordinate of the anchor point
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fillToHorizontal

        public Turtle fillToHorizontal(double y)
        Draws a imaginary horizonatal line at given y coordinate. When the global turtle now moves, the trapezoidal area covered by this line and the turtle position is filled with the current pen color. Filling is on until fillOff() is called.
        Parameters:
        y - the y coordinate of the horizontal line
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fillToVertical

        public Turtle fillToVertical(double x)
        Draws a imaginary vertical line at given x coordinate. When the global turtle now moves, the trapezoidal area covered by this line and the turtle position is filled with the current pen color. Filling is on until fillOff() is called.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the vertical line
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fillOff

        public Turtle fillOff()
        Stops the filling started by calling fillToPoint(), fillToHorizontal() or fillToVertical().
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • clone

        public Turtle clone()
        Creates a clone of the current global turtle by performing a deep copy of all its properties. Can be used to "stamp" a turtle e.g. to create a fixed turtle image at the current location. The new turtle is put on top of other turtles.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a reference to the new turtle object

      • delay

        public static void delay(long timeout)
        Halts the current thread for the given time.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the time (in ms) the current thread sleeps

        the trimmed text in the edit field. An empty string is valid
